# Tarkington High School

| schooltype              = Public
| established             =
| district                = Tarkington Independent School District
| principal               = Jennifer Fierro
| faculty                 = 33.40 (on FTE basis)
| grades                  = 9-12
| enrollment              = 552 (2023-2024)
| ratio                   = 16.53
| colors                  = Maroon and gold
| conference              = UIL 4A
| mascot                  = Longhorn
| homepage                =
}}
Tarkington High School is a public high school serving students grades 9â€“12 located in Tarkington Prairie, Liberty County, Texas, United States, 7.5 miles from Cleveland, Texas. It is the only high school part of the Tarkington Independent School District. It is attended by students residing in communities of Tarkington, Ainsworth, Rayburn, and Macedonia, and other portions of Liberty County. Students compete in UIL Region 3A. In 2022, the school received a "B" rating from the Texas Education Agency. In 2015, it was commended for meeting all indexes and having high improvement in performance.
Athletics
The Tarkington Longhorns participate in the following sports:
* Baseball
* Basketball
* Cross country
* Football
* Golf
* Powerlifting
* Softball
* Tennis
* Track and field
* Volleyball
Notable alumni
* Jason Grimsley, Major League Baseball pitcher
